  physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady. She is looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. She is wearing her ethnic costume and sitting down on a chair. Her feet are placed on an elevated platform and the floor is carpeted. A fan is being held by her.

  sgcool_label_text: This photograph shows a nyonya posing before a backdrop of a neoclassical interior.\r\n\r\nStudios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s
 Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a nyonya posing before a backdrop of a neoclassical interior.

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
